intro: Symphyostemon albus, commonly known as the white symphyostemon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its family.
